function: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
static_description: The main application shell with a navigation bar, content area, and footer. All components styled with a light pink background (#FFB6C1) and medium violet red (#C71585) colored elements.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on navigation links triggers fetching data from corresponding backend endpoints via API calls and updates the content area dynamically without full page reload.

resource_dependency.postgresqlDatabaseSchema: Create tables: users (id, username, password_hash, role), clients (client_id, name, email, phone, address), call_logs (log_id, client_id, user_id, call_type, description, created_at, status), actions_taken (action_id, log_id, description, timestamp), follow_ups (followup_id, log_id, description, due_date, completed), additional_notes (note_id, log_id, note_text)

function: A backend API server connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
static_description: RESTful API server running at port 3001 exposing endpoints for managing clients, call logs, actions, follow-ups, and authentication. Uses PostgreSQL as persistent storage configured through provided environment variables.

resource_dependency.clientDataSchema: Fields: client_id (UUID), name (string), email (string), phone (string), address (text)

function: Client identification functionality with search and selection capabilities
static_description: Search bar labeled 'Find Client', accompanied by a magnifying glass icon (referenced as searchIconSVG). Below it, a scrollable list container displays matching clients when searched.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a client entry selects the client and populates relevant fields in the calling form (e.g., New Call Log Form).
Typing in the search bar triggers debounced API requests to clientSearchEndpoint which returns filtered results displayed below.

function: Call type selection dropdown or radio button component
static_description: Dropdown menu labeled 'Call Type' with options populated from callTypesList. Styled with medium violet red border and arrow icon referenced as dropdownArrowIcon.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking opens/closes the dropdown revealing/hiding available call types. Selecting an option updates the selected value visually and internally stores it for submission.

function: Information recording form for capturing call details
static_description: Form containing multiple text inputs and textareas labeled 'Description', 'Caller Name', 'Phone Number'. Includes a submit button styled according to formSubmitButtonStyle.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the submit button sends collected form data to the backend API endpoint for saving new call logs.

function: Action step recording section for documenting actions taken during calls
static_description: Section titled 'Actions Taken' featuring a textarea with placeholder text set to stepInputPlaceholder followed by an 'Add Action' button.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Add Action' submits the entered text to addActionStepAPI and appends the newly added action to the visible list within this section.

function: Follow-up step recording functionality for scheduling future actions
static_description: Section titled 'Schedule Follow-Up' with date picker input field of type followUpDateInputType and a multiline text area for notes, ending with an 'Add Follow-Up' button.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Add Follow-Up' submits the date and note to addFollowUpAPI and adds the item to the follow-up list shown under this section.

function: Additional information recording field for miscellaneous call notes
static_description: Textarea labeled 'Additional Notes' allowing free-form text entry for extra call context. Positioned beneath primary sections but above the save controls.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a nearby 'Save Notes' button posts the current content of the textarea to saveNotesAPI to persist changes.

function: New call log creation form with all required data fields
static_description: Complete multi-section form integrating client selector, call type dropdown, information recorder, action steps, follow-ups, and additional notes areas. Ends with a prominent 'Create Log' button.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Create Log' validates requiredFieldsList presence and sends compiled data to newCallLogCreationAPI to register the new call log in the system.

function: Open calls view displaying unresolved customer service calls
static_description: Page/view titled 'Open Calls' showing a vertical list of items formatted per openCallItemDisplayTemplate. Each item includes basic identifying info like caller name and call type.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking any individual call item navigates to the detailed view/edit page for that specific call log.

function: To-do calls view showing pending follow-up actions
static_description: Separate view/page named 'Pending Tasks' listing upcoming tasks derived from scheduled follow-ups, formatted using todoItemTemplate showing due dates and brief descriptions.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a task item redirects to the associated call log detail screen where the task originated.

function: Call log reporting feature with export capabilities
static_description: Reports dashboard presenting filter options (by date range, user, etc.) along with buttons labeled 'Export as PDF' and 'Export as CSV' reflecting exportFormatsSupported.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking either export button triggers generation and download of the report file via generateReportAPI with appropriate format parameter.

function: Client creator wizard for adding new customer information
static_description: Multi-step modal/dialog presenting sequential forms based on wizardStepsDefinition guiding users through collecting comprehensive client profile data before finalizing creation.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Next' progresses through wizard steps while validating input. Clicking 'Finish' submits accumulated data to createClientAPI to store the new client record.

function: Client information modification interface for updating existing client data
static_description: Edit form mirroring editableClientFields pre-filled with current client data. Features standard save/cancel buttons aligned with form styling.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Save Changes' sends updated field values to editClientDetailsAPI to update the respective clientâ€™s record in the database.

resource_dependency.roleBasedAccessControlRules: Admin can do everything; Agent can view/edit logs; Viewer can only read logs
resource_dependency.userRoleCheckMiddleware: Implemented in backend routes to enforce access restrictions

function: Permission control system for managing user access levels
static_description: Backend middleware integrated into all protected routes checking user roles against roleBasedAccessControlRules before granting or denying access to requested operations.
